message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.CL. 

The paper focuses on developing deep convolutional network models for human activity recognition in still images, which is a common task in computer vision and falls under the category of cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also utilizes multiple instance learning and weighted loss, which are techniques commonly used in machine learning and fall under the category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper shows how the specialized features trained on the human activity recognition datasets can be used to improve accuracy on the Visual Question Answering (VQA) task, which falls under the categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.MM (Multimedia), and cs.CL (Computation and Language). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, and cs.CL, in that order.
